title: Castles Were Status Symbols
description: One-minute skill: Castles Were Status Symbols.

hook.text: Medieval castles look military, but many were barely defensible. Their real purpose was showing off power.

buildup.text: Building a castle required enormous wealthâ€”stone quarrying, skilled masons, and years of labor.

discovery.text: Lords often added decorative towers and oversized gatehouses that looked intimidating but served no tactical role.

twist.text: When cannons arrived in the 1400s, tall stone walls became a liability. Castles became mansions almost overnight.

climax.text: The shift from defense to display created the country house tradition that dominates European architecture today.

quiz.question: What made tall castle walls obsolete in the 1400s?
